name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, straw, UntilYouAreSoNude, madnes, stanshall, nobodyhome, shrewbie, chochacho, Moraiat, Connellingus, Weretrout, MortisInvictus, Sargasm, Lumus, Mbain3001, smugairle, chatterjee, regrepsnefpoh, TheLastWhiteMan, ravindra108, Fcannon, FinnS, Badgerus, sncether, littlefatdog, havenless, M-E-Charm, Centipede_Damascus, fortunagolde, flynn)

name: geysershitdick
text: A comment left by geysershitdick was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by FVVS, Deusoma, svenkta, jimbob, Satyr, aperson)

name: straw
text: What can you do?  He's the Pat of the Achewood comments section

name: songbirdspectre
text: HAHAHA!

name: badganjil
text:
Dude... you completely nailed it.
Thanks for clearing that up! I was confused.

name: blarghamagarky
text: his blog probably sucks though.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Was it wrong to chubby this even though I never read any of his comments (they're all lamed)?

name: ted0phile
text: Seek the answer in your avatar.

name: appers
text: That is so not true. There's a reason, if your lame threshold is set high enough, asherdan's comments are always the most chubbied as well- guy just knows how it is.

name: catachresis
text: It feels harsh that all the plot-advancement strips are rated 3.bumfuck

name: fuckyoufriday
text: At least some strips are averaging below a 4. I mean, I love achewood as much as the rest of you, but if every strip is rated above median, what's the point? I'm starting to lowball my ratings so a 5 means an all-time favorite, 4 means hilarious and very memorable, 3 means good & solid, etc.

name: catachresis
text: I go with 4 for most of them: solid dialogue etc and just achewood brilliance. 5 is for the classics, 3 is for when an arc veers into stupidity or a joke misfires. 2 is for seriously weak strips. 1 is for reruns.

name: charchar
text: I don't know about you all, but I still have that honour-roll mentality, where anything below an 85 (becomes 4.5) is just unacceptable. A 3 is like a 60: that's a F.

name: saucy_jack
text:
I am retrospectively so glad that a month of combined major depression, stress, and sleep deprivation rid me of the honor-roll mentality.

It was a hard life. I now see that it is OK to have a C sometimes. My life does not require an A average to happen.

name: charchar
text: Month 4 of mine.  I understand thet a "D" is passing on a logical level, but I still get this image of myself growing up to be the lowest-paid stripper in Arkansas

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
Not even.

Ds are on par with becoming a freelance fluffer or something.

name: charchar
text: Dude this did not help at all .

name: tekende
text: On the other hand, a couple of D's would be good to have as a stripper.

name: puguglypress
text: A 60 is NOT an F.

name: arcibi
text: Somehow I don't think rats getting it on in your salad would pass a health inspection

name: ssddr
text: Not just doing it, doing it Missionary style!

name: artvandelay
text: Years later I am still trying to figure out why Showbiz apparently considers missionary position to be the most disgusting sexual position to find two rats in, in your food.

name: tekende
text:
I would have gone with "reverse cowgirl style" but I guess that's just me.

Seriously, though, picture two rats in that position.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: boo to that.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Showbiz doesn't know when to stop fronting.

name: never_die
text: Ray's gesture and expression in panel 2.

name: zefiel
text: Is beef in panel 5 saying that the rats getting it on missionary style sound good to him? That's the way I've always read it.

name: jesler729
text: I think he knows Showbiz is lying and is getting hell of suspicious

name: deusoma
text: *I* think he's responding to what Ray said. Ray, of course, having completely ignored everything Showbiz said while engrossed in the menu.

name: closefriend
text: There's something ironic about two brothers being mistaken for one another, one having a much lower status then the other, while walking into a restaurant named after the antagonist from The Man in the Iron Mask .

name: rowboat
text: Dang! I knew there was some reason to stay in college.

name: tomsonlocal
text: I think Beef's look in panel 1 is to do with fears he may have if his wine taste are brought into question in the resteraunt.

name: minortough
text: As far as jokes in the strip go, it's pretty boring. But the alt-text where Onstad criticizes his own continuity errors get me every time.

name: ctrl_z
text: Missionary style? That's sick!

name: 21echoes
text: why is this rated so low?
